txt.en: Whatever killed the man on the road in the northern Writhendowns is likely nearby.\n\nYou should search to the south, towards the Isingmere lake.
You have found an empty fishing village on the edge of the Isingmere lake
A tower stands alone upon an island in the northern Isingmere lake, filling you with dread when you look upon it.\n\nYou should investigate the tower upon the island.
The wailing is very clear and nearby. It appears to be coming from the island with the lighthouse.

Something unnatural has killed this man upon this very road. He bears no marks or injuries. It appears that he has fallen where he stood.\n\nAn eerie mist encircles him, and a faint wailing can be heard nearby....
'I need assistance from one who yet lives. Will you hear my plea?'
Wailing sounds can be heard off in the distance and are bothering the citizens of Scylfig.
A villager in Scylfig was complaining about a wailing sound coming from the direction of the old fishing village along the north-east end of the lake.
Something unnatural has killed a man upon the road in the northern Writhendowns.
The wailing is most certainly nearby. Continue to follow the sound to locate the source.
The wailing is coming from the island with the lighthouse. The source should be found there.
A Daegul stands upon the island in the northern Isingmere lake.\n\nYou should speak with the Daegul.
Search for whatever may have killed the man
Continue to follow the wailing sound that is emanating from the water
Investigate the tower standing upon the island
